member.summary: Gets or sets the SdkLinksOnWeb property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the IncludeFavorites property.
member.remarks: Turning this flag on will include a Favorites tab in the HTML Help file.

member.name: P:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.Msdn2DocumenterConfig.RootPageTOCName
member.summary: Gets or sets the RootPageTOCName property.
member.remarks: The name for the table-of-contents entry corresponding to the root page. If this is not specified and RootPageFileName is, then the TOC entry will be 'Overview'.

member.name: P:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.Msdn2DocumenterConfig.RootPageFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the RootPageFileName property.
member.remarks: The name of an html file to be included as the root home page. "

member.name: P:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.Msdn2DocumenterConfig.RootPageContainsNamespaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the RootPageContainsNamespaces property.
member.remarks: If true, the Root Page will be made the container of the namespaces in the table-of-contents. If false, the Root Page will be made a peer of the namespaces in the table-of-contents.

member.name: P:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.Msdn2DocumenterConfig.BinaryTOC
member.summary: Gets or sets the BinaryToc property.
member.remarks: Create a binary table-of-contents file. This can significantly reduce the amount of time required to load a very large help document.

member.name: P:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.Msdn2DocumenterConfig.HeaderHtml
member.summary: Gets or sets the HeaderHtml property.
member.remarks: Raw HTML that is used as a page header instead of the default blue banner. "%FILE_NAME%\" is dynamically replaced by the name of the file for the current html page. "%TOPIC_TITLE%\" is dynamically replaced by the title of the current page.

member.name: P:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.Msdn2DocumenterConfig.FooterHtml
member.summary: Gets or sets the FooterHtml property.
member.remarks: Raw HTML that is used as a page footer instead of the default footer. "%FILE_NAME%\" is dynamically replaced by the name of the file for the current html page. "%ASSEMBLY_NAME%\" is dynamically replaced by the name of the assembly for the current page. "%ASSEMBLY_VERSION%\" is dynamically replaced by the version of the assembly for the current page. "%TOPIC_TITLE%\" is dynamically replaced by the title of the current page.

member.name: P:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.Msdn2DocumenterConfig.FilesToInclude
member.summary: Gets or sets the FilesToInclude property.
member.remarks: Specifies external files that must be included in the compiled CHM file. Multiple files must be separated by a pipe ('|').

member.name: P:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.Msdn2DocumenterConfig.AdditionalContentResourceDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the AdditionalContentResourceDirectory property
member.remarks: Directory that contains resources (images etc.) used by the additional content pages. This directory will be recursively compiled into the help file.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ExtensibilityStylesheet property
member.remarks: Path to an xslt stylesheet that contains templates for documenting extensibility tags.

member.param: CRef for which the name will be looked up.

member.name: M:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.MsdnXsltUtilities.HasSimilarOverloads(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up, whether a member has similar overloads, that have already been documented.
member.param: A string describing this overload.
member.returns: true, if there has been a member with the same description.

remarks.para: On the members pages overloads are cumulated. Instead of adding all overloads to the members page, a link is added to the members page, that points to an overloads page.
If for example one overload is public, while another one is protected, we want both to appear on the members page. This is to make the search for suitable members easier.

This leads us to the similarity of overloads. Two overloads are considered similar, if they have the same name, declaring type, access (public, protected, ...) and contract (static, non static). The description contains these four attributes of the member. This means, that two members are similar, when they have the same description.

Asking for the first time, if a member has similar overloads, will return false. After that, if asking with the same description again, it will return true, so the overload does not need to be added to the members page.

member.name: M:NDoc.Documenter.Msdn2.MsdnXsltUtilities.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Exposes to XSLT
member.param: The string to search
